title: Microwave Reheating Guide for Cookies

items.name: Standard chocolate chip cookie
items.details: Start with 10-15 seconds, check warmth, add a few more seconds in short increments until desired warmth. Avoid overheating to prevent loss of texture.

items.name: Single attempt (no monitoring)
items.details: 15 seconds is a safe conservative estimate for a standard-sized cookie. May be slightly underdone but avoids overheating.

items.name: Large cookie (frisbee-sized)
items.details: Start with 30-40 seconds as a baseline. Use oven mitts when handling as it may be very hot. Check if it fits in the microwave first.

items.name: Cookie too large for microwave
items.details: Use a conventional oven or toaster oven instead. These provide better heat distribution for oversized cookies.

notes: Always start with shorter times and increase gradually. Microwave power varies, so exact times depend on your machine. Monitor closely to prevent overcooking or burning edges.
